page.title: 14Norton Hall, Norton
page.content: Opposite the Morganite Crucible factory there lies a mile of rough grassland beyond which one can see what is known as Norton Hall. Over the years it has become derelict after being neglected by its owner. It was purchased by a consortium in 1984 who are now restoring the hall. The local gentry used to own and live in the hall. It is interesting to note that all the farm labourers cottages that remain, that used to belong to the estate, have been restored for use to day. Many of these householders own a few sheep or ducks. The stables are now used as equipment sheds. Most people maintains an attractive garden. The Hall used to be an Army barracks. The locals are pleased to see it being restored to its former glory.
